reviewText: I gotta say I am more of a KISS fan than AC/DC. My uncle gave me this DVD on my birthday about 3 years ago. I saw it and I couldn't stop. This is one of my favorite bands and this item, one of the best DVD's I own.1.- "Newsflash".- This one is not really a song. It is more of a presenatation. A funny presentation about the "Angus Statue", the bands lead guitarist.-2.- "Stiff Upper Lip".- One of AC/DC's best songs. It is a great intro for a great concert.- 10/10.3.- "You Shook Me All Night Long".- Fantastic song. One of the best of all times. I love this one.- 10/104.- "Problem Child".- Great song and great lyrics.- 9/10.5.- "Thunderstruck".- A fantastic song with a hell of a guitar intro and drum sound.- 10/10.6.- "Hell Ain't A Bad Place To Be".- I like this one. A great rock song from AC/DC.- 9/10.7.- "Hard As Rock".- Great one. One of AC/DC's best.- 10/10.8.- "Shoot To Thrill".- I like this one. One of their best songs they've ever wrote.- 10/10.9.- "Rock And Roll Ain't Noise Pollution".- A song with a great chorus.- 8/10.10.- "What Do You Do For Money Honey".- Another great song from AC/DC. This band rocks.- 10/10.11.- "Bad Boy Boogie".- I like this song as much as "Rock And Roll Ain't Noise Pollution". Ladies will recive a surprise in this one.- 8/10.12.- "Hell's Bells".- Great song. Terrific.- 10/10.13.- "Up To My Neck In You".- I like this one. A great ROCK AND ROLL SONG".- 9/10.14.- "The Jack".- Great song.- 9/10.15.- "Back In Black".- Another one of my favorite songs ever written. I think the banda sonora of the movie "Men In Black II".- 10/1016.-"Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap".-One of my favorite songs of all times. I think this one is kind of the banda sonora of one os my favorite all-time movies: "Dirty Work". Check that movie out. It's hilarious.- 10/10.17.- "Highway To Hell".- WOW. Another one of my favorite songs. This DVD rocks all the way!!!! .- 10/10.18.- "Whole Lotta Rosie".- I love this song. One of my favorite's from AC/DC.- 10/10.19.- "Let There Be Rock".- I like this song. But not as much as "Whole Lotta Rosie" or "Highway To Hell".- 8/10.20.- "T.N.T".- WOW even anotherone of my all-time favorite's. I first heard it on the videogame: "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4".- 10/10.21.- "For Those About To Rock (We Salute You)".- A great, great song with an amazing cannons that fire.- 10/10.22.- "Shot Down In Flames".- Not too crazy about this one but it gives a great outro for a concert as such.- 7/10.23.- "Credits".- Just the credits where the names of the band appear.See. I recomend this item. Very much. I always thought this was one of their best concerts EVER!!!AC/DC RULES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Johnson has absolutely nothing to prove... He's part of AC/DC, he contributed decisively to the band's fortunes, he's good humored, a real fine singer, a great guy.But the trouble is that all those years delivering that thunderous, unique and marvellous lead vocals made Brian pay the price...Nowadays, his singing is just annoying. AC/DC can get away with that because their live act is so good, so energetic, that Brian's part becomes just a by-side attraction, since most of the audience in an AC/DC concert know the songs by memory.But to watch the concert in the comfort of your house, it is getting harder and harder to listen to Brian...No amount of digital effects can disguise this fact...As for the band, it's competent and energetic as always.
summary: The trouble is Brian Johnson's voice.....
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't think AC/DC are capable of putting on a bad concert. I first saw these guys live 25 years ago (yikes). At that time I'd only heard of them. What I saw that night blew me away, and I've followed them ever since.Too bad this video sucks. The problem isn't the band, it's the video director or producer (not sure who exactly to blame). They insisted on cycling through 20 different camera angles multiple times per minute. I felt like a rubber ball ricocheting all over the stage, the audience, the sound equipment, the scafolding, etc. The average duration of any one scene is about 3 seconds! Trying to watch this was like experiencing vertigo. I finally just turned off the TV and listened to the concert (which was, as always, great).AC/DC is a dynamic band with an incredible performance here. They don't need bouncing camera angles to increase the intensity of their performance. In my opinion that ruined what could otherwise have been the ultimate video concert.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: John S. Harris "The Voice of Reason"
reviewText: First off, this DVD was released with the DTS stereo option, so you're in for a sonic treat if you have a DTS-decoding receiver and DVD player.The band from Down Under is still giving it their all, some 70+ years or so after they started rockin'.  Well, maybe not 70 years, but it seems that bands hang around that long lately.  But to hear Brian Johnson and the Young brothers tell it, AC/DC still enjoy performing today as much as they ever did.  And they have very respecful things to say about their fans, which is refreshing.The DVD is mostly concert footage plus a few minutes of interview footage thrown in.  The whole band participates in the interviews, not just the "principals".  AC/DC is a great band for those who like meat-and-potatoes rock and roll:  Good, old-fashioned crunchy guitars and 3 chord noise.  No fancy pretensions, just a good ol' time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Being old enough to have witnessed the history of Rock n' Roll, it is my humble opinion that four bands form the corners of the Universe: the Beatles, the Stones, Led Zepplin, and, of course, AC-DC. Also, IMHO, Angus Young is the last surviving guitar god. This band defines energy and androgyny, and getting a little long in the tooth hasn't hurt them a bit. I saw them on this tour, and the DVD does it justice. You can tell when a band has reached the ultimate level, because it's hard to find a "greatest hits" album, because, quite frankly, everything they did is great.  There really isn't a bad track on this, so it is hard for me to pick one out over the others. Get this disc, turn down the lights, do air guitar with Angus and imagine you are the fifth member of maybe the greatest... band of all time.

reviewText: Recorded at Munich, this DVD has amazing video, great set list, great performance by the band, but lousy edition. It's so fast, you just can't marvel at anyone's performance long enough! Absolutely frustrating!The vibe of the show is fantastic, you'll feel like you're up stage with the band. I don't like Johnson's voice, it's apparently ruined beyond reparation, but he's an important part of the band.

reviewText: This is a great AC/DC DVD! Just like every other AC/DC DVD so far! This show is rocking, great and you will enjoy yourself if your into this kind of music.Its a live show with a great selection of there many hits, AC/DC fans are always a little disapointed when there fav. songs arnt on a live show, but with AC/DC having had so many hits and favs with the fans, it would be hard to do a show that goes for a week!What you get is AC/DC doing what they do best. This time round theres been some more done with some props and piro then on the previous tours and DVD shows! There is a big statue of Angus called "jnr" behind them all during the show, it blows out smoke, it moves around, and its eyes glow red, theres piro crackling off, bells ringing, cannons going off, and fire shooting out of the stage during "highway to hell" and of coarse Angus up to what he's done best for the last 30 years, duck walking and running around, and getting up close with the crowed on the cat walk!It dosent come with subtitles which [...] :(but it comes with a little interveiw with the band, and showing a bit of behind the scenes with them, but nothing a non die hard fan would be intrested in watchign more then once i dont think? I do wish there was more packed into it! but This is still the must have for the AC/DC fan, they maybe a little older, and going grey, but there music is still the best its ever been, and the shows are just getting better and better as youll see on this great DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: They may be getting on in years a bit, but this conert in Munich proved that AC/DC still has the goods.  All the major tunes are here, plus a few juicy bits from bygone days.  Angus puts on an act during Bad Boy Boogie that brings the house down.  The guitars shine during Thunderstruck and Hard as a Rock, which has a little video presentation on the screens behind the band.  The intro featuring a giant walking animated version of the Angus statue they bring on tour was cool.  Overall, I'd say it was well worth the price.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Stiff Upper Lip" captures AC/DC working their butts off on a tour and even though they're aging, they prove that they can still deliver electrifying performances. This one is no short of excellent as they go through a huge chunk of their massive repetoire, covering the old and the new. Of course Brian Johnson can quite reach the high notes like he used to be able to, but believe me, this guy has energy and you can tell he is working hard. "You Shook Me All Night Long" really sets the tone for the show, and Angus Young gives a killer solo. My personal favourites from this concert are the performances from the Back in Black album, which include a great performance of the self titled track, a hard, blues tinged "Rock n' Roll Ain't Noise Pollution", and a heavy version of "What Do You Do For Money, Honey?". "Shoot To Thrill" is another great one on here as AC/DC gets the whole crowd involved. "Thunderstruck" as usual lights up the audience and this is a top notch performance of the song. "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap" and "TNT" show the band digging into the older stuff, and they a great job of it, and Angus kills the solos.Overall, if you are a diehard AC/DC fan, you must have this DVD. I myself am a casual fan but wanted to see what their live shows are like and picked this up. It is excellent stuff. Highly recommended.
Title: N/A

reviewText: THis DVD features the best rock band of the world with the worst singer of the world (Brian Johnson). Seeing the guy singing live is very emotional.. Johnson seems like he's about to die, such is the strenght he is forced to use to "sing" even one note!! Amazing...!!But the guy has enough charisma to blow away one hundred rock singers put together ("singers" like Axl Rose, for example). He has absolute control of the audience.What we have here is the costumary AC/DC live set: Malcolm and Cliff each at an opposite side of Phil Rudd's drums, Johnson and Angus up ahead in the stage. Johnson never introduces the band members to the audience. There are no "polictical" speeches, no pretended "dephtness" to their performance. IT's just sraight ahead, solid, marvellous, punching rock'n roll. And of course, if you're a little bit intelligent, you will have to swallow some of the worst lyrics ever wrote (mainly those of the Brian Johnson period), when you have to endure grown men of more than forty five years of age singing about getting laid, giving them pleasure, showing them their "toys", etc, etc....This band, never one to give interviews easily, is very clever. The extra at the ending (interview) is so brief, so fast (ultra fast editions of the guys in the backstage, going to the concert and giving interviews to the camera), that you just keep wanting more.The set list is very well chosen, and the execution by the band is flawless. Obligatory aquisition.
summary: The best band with the worst singer
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm repeating here my review for NO BULL, because I think the reasoning apllies here also. The difference is that AC/DC new DVD features an amazing production and sound quality.1992's LIVE AT DONINGTON is better than STIFF UPPER LIP. The explanations are simple: first. Chris Slade is a much better drummer than Phil Rudd, and Donington provesthis very clearly!Second, Brian Johnson's voice was still close to top-notch form in 1992.What impress me most in AC/DC concerts (I mean the oficial video / DVD releases, since LET THERE BE ROCK) is how a band that sends such energy, entertainment and eletricity to the audience seems to be so joyless while playing their act....Never once I've seen Malcolm and Phil and Cliff exchange one single smile to each other or to Brian or Angus ahead in the stage. This is a common feature in bands playing live, as if to say to each other: "Ok, this night we're kicking as... Everything's alright..", or something like that. You can check it in Iron Maiden videos or Judas Priest videos, for example.....Angus climbs up Brian's shoulder, that's for sure, but he could be climbing upona wall, it would have the same effect, so "cold" seems the relationship between both of them on the stage...It seems that AC/DC members just don't care about each other, as long as everyone is doing their job... weird thing..
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD had potential for 5 stars, in spite of Brian Johnson's road-wearied pipes (I still give him an A for effort, 'tho). What nearly kills this is the haphazard editing...forget about trying to soak in the experience, 'cuz the camera angles change at an annoyingly machine gun-like pace. As a result, with maybe a few noticable exceptions, my recollection of this video is not much more than a huge visual blur. Such a shame too, 'cuz the picture quality actually is top-notch...what a waste of film. But the bottom line is this: the boys can still bring it, and are still capable of reducing many of today's bands into little girly men. (Edit to add: a younger friend of mine--around 22 or so--never saw or heard much of AC/DC before, but after seeing this DVD commented "they look like they were literally born to do this"...indeed) If you caught AC/DC on this tour, you pretty much know the bulk of the setlist, but at this particular show they dusted off a couple of nuggets you might not have seen ("Up To My Neck In You" & "What Do You Do For Money Honey"). Long story short...it's a great performance, but the rapid editing might test your resolve after awhile. Worse comes to worse, just turn off the video & listen to the audio...
summary: note to video editor: lay off the truckers' pills...
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was lucky enough to hear/see the band on the STIFF UPPER lip tour in Melbourne , Australia; Needless to say the venue was garbage compared to this concert in Munich. Anyways, the same vibe they had in the relatively small Melbourne Venue is here in the larger Munich  site.As is evidenced by the stage layout, and the marching "Angus" Statue in the prologue, The Schoolboy is the centre of attention.A mix of the then current album and the standards is great.The Camera coverage is way better than previous video releases ... one can only hope that they do as QUEEN has done, and released discs with extra coverage. Anyways, the band delivers in this release, and is truly a band for the fans, and even for those not mainly fans ... especially those who try and show off and not deliver what the fans want.AC/DC are the raw, top of the line concert animals who deliver  on CD, Video/DVD, as well as in person ... many artists could do well to copy this.

reviewText: Flat out balls to the wall from start to finish.  Then...what else would you expect from Angus, Malcolm and the boys?Great video, excellent sound and an extremely spirited performance.  Brian Johnson misses some of the high notes here and there...but hey!...he's friggin' screaming his heart out for nearly 2 hours.Angus is Angus..one of the best.  He plays several extended guitar solos which improvise on the "recorded" versions which is a real treat.And Malcolm?  His vocal lines on "Dirty Deeds Done Cheap" are worth the price of this disc alone.A great concert dvd for any level of AC/DC fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 2003 still remains to be the last time AC/DC toured, which has finally caused me to wonder if they are gonna do it again. After all, HOW THE FRIG CAN ANYONE DO IT FOR SO LONG? Ok, so, first I watched the DONINGTON DVD from 1991. I was like WOW! They are getting a little old but... STILL KICKIN' IT!Next I got the 2001 DVD. They look even older. Years of rock lifestyle in the most atomic degree HAS GOT to catch up with you. Right? Well, I guess if you want to judge a book by it's cover maybe... The DVD is still INTENSE!AC/DC stands for everything that is pure and simple and still god damned amazing in ROCK! They are down and dirty, but in a lighthearted, free spirited sort of way. And maybe fame and money effects them in real life, but seriously, I don't give a cool heap about it. I LIKE to pound my head to the same formula over and over, it's addicting... if you think every song sounds the same you must have years of wax in the ears...ok, a little slow dramatic intro to warm you up, it gets a little heavier when (thats good ol' PHIL RUDD) the 4/4 drums kick in, then BANG! I feel like findin' some ASS and GRASS! I just feel good, instantly... and these guys give it all the heart they've got, which makes me feel even better.I don't care what ANYBODY says... I flippin' LOVE, L-O-V-E LOVE, AC/DC........YEAH! Even better live!
Title: N/A
